instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message:
Got this MacBook Pro Retina 15

It had some minor liquid spill. Some sticky juice. Not very much mostly some sticky stains on top of cooler and RAM. Trackpad also little sticky.

It was not charging the battery so I tried another battery and this charged fine. 

Then I thought I would clean those sticky stains and cleaned it in uc.

Now I have got the chime but no image on either internal or external screen and fans goes slowly up to full speed.

Where do I start with this issue ?

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message: Did you let it dry sufficiently before powering it on? Do you get a chime? Was the liquid/residue near the BIOS/clock area?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message:
Yes I used an oven to dry it as I always do. 

Yes i I got a chime

No liquid around BIOS

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message: Try on SMC bypass.......

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message:
SMC bypass still no image or backlight. 

Same issue but on SMC bypass fans go full throttle right from the beginning (the normal startup starts quiet and fans go faster and faster and ends in full speed after couple of minutes)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message: GPU Vcore present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message: Yes is is  0,9V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message: Try with known good LCD of the correct year.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message: Same issue with known good display assembly :-(

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message: PRAM reset also tried of course. Did not mention it in the first post but it was the first thing I tried .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message: What external screen are you using? Thunderbolt port or HDMI?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message: I tried both ports. Normal minidisplay interface connected in the thunderbolt port though.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message:
It is trolling me...

I ran it through uc again. But now I have lost GPU VCORE. GPU gets hot though

Now I have no <SIGNAL>P3V3GPU_EN</SIGNAL> 

Symptoms still the same: Chime but no image.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message: Push on <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> and power on, see if Vcore comes high when you keep pressure on it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message:
Yes it comes om while holding the pressure 

Still no image and loosing GPU VCORE men releasing the pressure

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message: Resolder <CHIP>U9300</CHIP>. Do not pull it, just heat it up a bit and drag your iron along the pins with some fresh solder. This should at least solve GPU Vcore issue.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message: You're right. GPU VCORE is now back at 0.899 but still no image

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message: I have no idea. What kind of ultrasonic are you using?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message: Crest with es132 and dem. water

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message: Tested external image now Vcore is back?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message: Yes already tested. No image om either thunderbolt or HDMI.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> high?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No image after UC
threads.message:
Yes. <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> 3.4V

Customer needed the computer back urgently so I replaced the logic board. 

This board went to the maybe-fixable pile and I'll update this thread if I ever get back to it.

Thanks Duke as always for the assist.
